intro: Rhododendron lohitense, commonly known as the Lohit rhododendron, is a species native to the eastern Himalayas, particularly in regions of India and Nepal. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. The plant features dense, leathery leaves and produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and red. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas with acidic soils. Rhododendron lohitense plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
